author: Adam Bienkov, Business Insider UK
description: Prime Minister Theresa May responds to incident at the Manchester arena.
title: Theresa May condemns 'callous terrorist attack' that killed 22 people in Manchester

author: By Kate Ferguson, Political Correspondent For Mailonline
description: Theresa May has said her planned reforms to social care will end the torment of the elderly having to 'worry that their savings might whittle down to nothing'.
title: Theresa May defends her social care reforms

author: Andrew Griffin
description: A man has been arrested for protesting at Theresa May's visit to Wrexham. The activist was attempting to protest against fox hunting, in response to Ms May's suggestion that the practice is going to be legalised again. When the Prime Minister drove up to the community centre, he played a hunting bugle and shouted "save our wildlife, kill May".
title: Man arrested for protesting against Theresa May

author: Niamh McIntyre
description: The Conservatives will lose the general election if they lose “just six seats”, Theresa May has said.
title: Theresa May mocked over 'bizarre' Jeremy Corbyn Facebook post

description: Theresa May today reveals plans to strip people of their knighthoods if they fall below the “standards of integrity” expected by the public.
title: Theresa May knighthoods shake-up: Lose your gong if you dishonour it

author: BBC News
description: Some Conservatives fear Theresa May's social care plans for England will cost the party votes.
title: Theresa May faces Tory opposition to social care plans

description: The Telegraph asked Theresa May who would be at her dream dinner party, and here are her choices:
title: From Edward Whymper to Agatha Christie: Who would be at Theresa May's dream dinner party?

author: John Rentoul
description: Theresa May’s social care policy was designed to save public money, but today’s U-turn means she will probably end up with a policy that would cost taxpayers billions and that will still scare and confuse the voters.
title: Theresa May says 'nothing has changed'. Oh yes it has

description: Theresa May took a leaf straight out of Margaret Thatcher’s book last week with a choice of slogan that paid tribute to the former prime minister and signalled a new direction for Britain.
title: Why meddling Theresa May will provide another headache for business

author: Silvia Amaro
description: The explosion outside Manchester Arena on Monday night that killed 22 people was a "callous terrorist attack", U.K. Prime Minister Theresa May told the press after chairing an emergency meeting.
title: UK leader Theresa May condemns 'warped and twisted' terror attack in Manchester
